image.altText: A close up of a phone against a woman's ear.

props.synopsis: About 20 per cent of calls to South Australia's domestic violence crisis line are going unanswered, despite a recent boost in government funding to address demand, the state's peak body for domestic violence services says.

title.children: One in five calls to SA DV crisis line goes unanswered despite extra funding

image.altText: A 19th century single story manor house with a sign reading Ayers House in foreground

props.synopsis: Volunteer-run branches of the conservation charity, responsible for maintaining some of SA's most well-known landmarks, protest a new "service fee" on their earnings.

title.children: Leaked emails reveal National Trust's financial dispute with SA volunteers

image.altText: Adelaide Crows player Isaac  Cumming pumps his fist during an AFL match

props.synopsis: From summers spent training with Taylor Walker as a teen in Broken Hill to running out alongside him for his 100th game, it has been a wild ride for Isaac Cumming.

title.children: Crows' Isaac Cumming to mark 100 games alongside childhood idol

image.altText: Close up of someone holding a Nokia 3310 with "Should you use a 'dumphone'?" on the screen.

props.synopsis: A study finds that receiving a smartphone before age 13 is associated with poorer mental health in young adulthood, as some teens turn to "dumbphones" instead.

title.children: Smartphones affect young people's mental health. Are dumbphones the answer?

image.altText: A man stands in the foreground with a picture of another man on a screen in the background.

props.synopsis: Police believe the missing remains of alleged murder victim Julian Story have been found by a member of the public, but say testing will be undertaken to confirm. Warning: This story contains content some readers may find distressing.

title.children: SA Police believe missing remains of Julian Story have been found

image.altText: A composite image of Anna Panella, Bernard Skeffington and Graham Jessett

props.synopsis: A South Australian coroner has called on the state government to "formally acknowledge" ramping is "a reality" and focus on making it safer for those who will "inevitably" experience it.

title.children: Coroner calls on SA government to make hospitals safer amid ramping death findings

image.altText: Damage car off cliff

props.synopsis: The owner of a car that rolled out of a driveway and dropped 40 metres from a cliff, south of Adelaide, says he was trying to charge the vehicle's battery when the incident occurred.

title.children: Car rolls out of driveway, goes over cliff, south of Adelaide

image.altText: A man in a blue and red shirt and jacket holding a lobster in a white room.

props.synopsis: The harmful algal bloom is already impacting the fishing industry, with producers asking customers to keep buying to avoid piling on pain.

title.children: SA fishers urge people to keep buying seafood amid algal bloom

image.altText: A man in a dark cap and jacket holds his arms up and points his finger at the camera in a theatre hall

props.synopsis: Hip hop artist Bousta is one of 13 emerging South Australia artists who will perform in front of music heavyweights in the annual Scouted showcase.

title.children: 'Catch my vibe': First Nations hip hop artist sings in two languages

image.altText: A man and a woman, both wearing blue suits, smile as they hold hands and walk outside a court building

props.synopsis: A court has heard that former MP Annabel Digance and her husband Greg were found guilty by a District Court Judge of blackmailing Premier Peter Malinauskas, but that the charge was dropped in exchange for them agreeing to leave the-then opposition leader alone.

title.children: Former MP who is suing SA Premier found guilty of blackmail, before charges were dropped

image.altText: A wide shot of Jerusalem shows the golden roof of the Dome of the Rock behind the large stone walls of the Al Aqsa Mosque area.

props.synopsis: Rabbis have forbidden approaching what is considered the site of the Holy of Holies in Jerusalem, but one right-wing religious activist is pushing to overturn centuries of tradition as tensions increase around the Al-Aqsa Mosque compound.

title.children: Right-wing rabbi enthusiastically ignores worship restrictions in Israel

image.altText: A blue background with images of Anthony Albanese, the YouTube logo and downward thumbs on top

props.synopsis: The government's announcement this week that YouTube would be included in the teen social media ban is a political backflip of Olympic proportions, and its first since the election. They pulled it off with surprising grace, but no landing is perfect, writes Ange Lavoipierre.

title.children: Government backflip on YouTube social media ban is one of Olympic proportions

image.altText: ASIO director-general Mike Burgess delivering a speech.

props.synopsis: Australia's domestic spy chief says it'll become a condition for individuals who hold an ASIO security clearance that they cannot post about it on social media. Follow live.

title.children: ASIO boss says agency to ban staff from advertising security clearances online

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Quiet meeting with FBI director Kash Patel 'really good', Burke says
Australia's 'reciprocal' baseline tariff to remain at 10 per cent
Husic says he believes middle Australia thinks humanitarian crisis in Gaza is 'awful'

image.altText: A blue hospital building.

props.synopsis: Monash Health in Melbourne's south-east has discovered black mould in an area where cancer patients are treated.

title.children: Major Melbourne hospital discovers black mould in cancer treatment area

image.altText: The Star logo high on the side of a glass-fronted building.

props.synopsis: Star Entertainment has missed the deadline to offload its stake in Brisbane's Queen's Wharf.

title.children: Star Entertainment misses deadline to offload stake in Brisbane's Queen's Wharf

image.altText: Lani Pallister, Jamie Perkins, Brittany Castelluzzo and Mollie O'Callaghan celebrate with their world championship gold medals.

props.synopsis: After taking gold in the 4x200m relay, Mollie O'Callaghan can eclipse Ian Thorpe to become Australia's outright leader in swimming world titles if she wins the 100m freestyle.

title.children: O'Callaghan Australia's greatest swimming world champ with 100m still to come

image.altText: Closeup of a hand on a senior citizen's holding a colourful ball

props.synopsis: Australia faces a potential escalation in cases of modern slavery, the NSW anti-slavery commissioner warns, as sectors such as aged care become increasingly reliant on temporary migrant workers.

title.children: The anti-slavery policies in NSW that could have global consequences

image.altText: A woman stands looking at small jewels which are encased in a square wooden frame inside a glass case

props.synopsis: The nearly 350-piece collection has been purchased by an Indian businessman in what is being described as a "public-private partnership" with the Indian government.

title.children: Ancient Buddha jewels return to India after legal threat

image.altText: A composite image of close ups of Danielle Wood and Jim Chalmers.

props.synopsis: Small companies would pay less tax, but the largest could pay more under a new reform proposal from the independent agency tasked with helping to shape Labor's economic reform agenda.

title.children: Small business tax cut to 20pc under new reform proposal

image.altText: Virginia Roberts Giuffre

props.synopsis: The family of deceased Jeffrey Epstein accuser Virginia Giuffre is urging US President Donald Trump not to grant clemency to Ghislaine Maxwell, the British socialite serving a 20-year prison sentence for helping Epstein abuse underage girls.

title.children: Epstein accuser Giuffre's family urges Trump to keep Maxwell in prison

image.altText: A man sits in a green chair

props.synopsis: Tasmanian independent MP Craig Garland has ruled out signing a confidence and supply agreement with Premier Jeremy Rockliff, saying the Marinus Link deal shows the Liberals have "learned nothing".

title.children: Breaking: Tasmanian Liberals' path to government harder as Garland rules out support

image.altText: Close up of a small marsupial mole being held in a hand.

props.synopsis: Move over, roos and emus — this National Science Week, we're looking for the most underrated Australian animal. Meet the contestants, and vote for who you think should win.

title.children: Meet the contestants for Australia's top underrated animal

image.altText: A child has their teeth examined by a dentist.

props.synopsis: A survey has found Australia's free childhood dental scheme is cloaked in confusion and misinformation, with many parents either unaware of its existence or unsure of their children's eligibility.

title.children: Confusion over free dental scheme putting children's mouths 'at risk'

image.altText: A drone shot of rows of houses in Shell Cove, Wollongong's south.

props.synopsis: Australian property prices have scaled new record highs as demand for housing offsets buyer concerns about the Reserve Bank's shock call to hold interest rates steady.

title.children: Home price climb continues despite interest rate pause

image.altText: An Indigenous man in traditional body paint dances.

props.synopsis: From the pain of a broken political promise and one community’s desire to push forward, the Garma festival was born.

title.children: The broken promise that has loomed over 25 years of Garma

image.altText: A drone over orange flames.

props.synopsis: The fighting between Thailand and Cambodia exposes the depth of global arms proliferation in South-East Asia, proving more sophisticated and deadly than experts expected.

title.children: Cluster bomb claims, Swedish jets stir outcry in Thai-Cambodia clash

image.altText: A woman with dark hair, wearing a black knit and fluffy hat, crosses her arms and looks serious, with mountains and lake behind.

props.synopsis: The Scottish forager is not a professional survivalist, but managed to be the last woman standing on Alone Australia.

title.children: How Corinne Ooms spent 70 days alone in the Tasmanian wilderness

image.altText: Jane Hume and Sarah Henderson

props.synopsis: Among Opposition Leader Sussan Ley's multiple problems are two very unhappy former frontbenchers.

title.children: Aggrieved Liberals stamp their feet, testing Ley's authority

image.altText: The exterior of a large, modern childcare centre photographed through lush gardens.

props.synopsis: Grow Early Education's Townsville centre, which has a history of not adequately supervising children, is under investigation again.

title.children: Queensland childcare centre with breach history under investigation again

image.altText: Australian swimmer Mollie O'Callaghan, seen from behind, holds the Australian flag above her head after the 200m freestyle.

props.synopsis: A lot happened this week. Did you take it all in?

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A gold medal, metal funeral and rocketship mishap

image.altText: A rolled up piece of paper inside of a glass bottle cloudy with brown residue.

props.synopsis: A specialist painter was working on one of Australia's oldest lighthouses when they "found such an exciting thing" — a bottle with a message inside.

title.children: Message in a bottle discovered in lighthouse wall after 122 years

image.altText: Weather signs, wet roads and cars

props.synopsis: A cold and wet week across NSW will culminate this weekend in heavy rain, strong winds and powerful surf along the coast.

title.children: NSW flood threat this weekend follows Sydney’s coldest July day in decades
